intro: Windmannia laurina, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense, velvety pubescence. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. Windmannia laurina is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and floral display.
